entry.title: pulley shoe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that medieval historians believed that the pulley shoe (wearers pictured) was used to chase women lewdly while turning its wearers gay?

entry.title: Jake Ryan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jake Ryan has acted in Wes Anderson films since he was seven?

entry.title: Panzer Dragoon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the course of the Panzer Dragoon series has been said to parallel the history of the Sega Saturn?

entry.title: Ivo Rojnica (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1941 Ivo Rojnica ruled that all Serbs and Jews were banned from walking the streets of Dubrovnik at night?

entry.title: European Sky Shield Initiative (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the European Sky Shield Initiative is expected to have anti-ballistic missile capability?

entry.title: Max Steinberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an estimated 30,000 people attended the funeral of Max Steinberg, an Israeli lone soldier who was killed during the 2014 Gaza War?

entry.title: Hotel Normandie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Hotel Normandie supported the Leaders of the World?

entry.title: Pamela Stephenson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that comedian Pamela Stephenson was pleased that her 1987 book How to Be a Complete Bitch was described as "sexist, violent and crude"?
